byline.contributor: Brian X. Chen, Nick Wingfield and Mike Isaac contributed reporting.
byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and CONOR DOUGHERTY

abstract: News Analysis; sexual discrimination lawsuit brought by former junior partner Ellen Pao against venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers may result in increased documentation and bureaucracy at venture capital firms across the board, bringing freewheeling era to end; Pao claims to have discovered Twitter as potential investment for firm, but has no documentation to prove it.
lead_paragraph: A recurring issue was who originated investment ideas at the venture capital firm and the lack of documentation to support claims.

headline.main: After Kleiner Trial, Expect Less Shooting From the Hip in Silicon Valley
headline.print_headline: After Kleiner Trial, Silicon Valley Enters a More Cautious Era

snippet: A recurring issue was who originated investment ideas at the venture capital firm and the lack of documentation to support claims.
